message: I have a high-quality product for sale for $10000. I'm willing to offer a 10% discount if you buy it now, but if you decline, the price will go back to $10000. What do you say?
I'll pass on this one, I'll wait for the next product.

I see you're a cautious buyer! I'm willing to make a deal with you. If you buy this high-quality product, I'll throw in a free inspection report that guarantees its authenticity. The price remains at $10000. What do you say?
I'm not convinced that the inspection report is worth the extra $39000 to me. I'll pass.

I understand your skepticism. Let me be upfront with you - this product may not be the best quality. However, I'm willing to sell it to you for a 'loss' of $1000, bringing the price down to $9000. I'm taking a significant risk here, but I think it's a fair deal considering the price you're used to paying for high-quality products.
I'm not falling for it. If it's low-quality, I'd be wasting my money. I'll pass.

I understand your concerns, but I want to be transparent with you. I'll give you a straight-up deal: this product is indeed low-quality, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $5000. It's a significant discount from the original price, and I'm essentially giving it away. If you're not interested, I'll keep looking for a buyer who will appreciate it.
I'm not paying $5000 for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'll pass.

I see you're a savvy buyer. I'll make an even more transparent offer: I'll give you this low-quality product for free. Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for nothing. I just want to get it off my hands. If you're still not interested, I'll dispose of it myself.
You're really giving it away, are you? Alright, I'll take it. Thanks for the free product!

I'm glad you could take advantage of the offer! Now, let's move on to the next product. I have to admit, I'm a bit surprised you bought the last one for free. I'll offer you a 'premium' low-quality product for $8000. It's a special deal, and I'm not sure how long it will last.
I'm not falling for another low-quality product, no matter how 'premium' it is. I'll pass.

I see you're sticking to your guns. Let me ask you a question: are you willing to take a chance on a mystery product? I'll wrap this low-quality product in a plain box and give it to you without telling you what it is. If you buy it, the price remains at $8000. It's a risk, but it might be a good opportunity to get a high-quality product for a steal.
I'm not interested in buying a mystery product, especially if it's low-quality. I'll pass.

I'm glad you're cautious with the mystery product. Now, let's get back to a straightforward offer. I have a high-quality product that I think you'll really like. I'll give you a special'second-chance' deal: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 20% discount, bringing the price down to $8000. This is a one-time offer, and I think you'll be happy with the quality of this product.
I've been burned twice already, and I'm not falling for the discount without knowing the quality. I'll pass.

I understand your skepticism, but I want to assure you that this product is top-notch. I'm willing to offer a 'certification guarantee': if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund and throw in a $1000 bonus. That's a $11000 value for just $10000. I'm confident in the quality of this product, and I think you'll be happy with it.
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm not convinced that you'll actually follow through on it. I'll pass.

I understand your concerns about the guarantee, but I want to assure you that I'm a reputable seller. Let me put it this way: I'm willing to put my reputation on the line. If you buy this high-quality product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll not only give you a full refund, but I'll also give you a $2000 credit towards your next purchase. That's a $12000 value for just $10000. I'm confident that you'll be happy with this product, and I'm willing to back it up.
I'm still not convinced that you'll follow through on your promises. I'll pass.

I understand you're still skeptical. Let me make it clear that this product is indeed low-quality. I'm not trying to hide it from you. I'll sell it to you for $0. Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for free. I just want to get it off my hands. No strings attached, no expectations. Take it or leave it.
You're really giving it away, are you? Alright, I'll take it. Thanks for the free product!

I'm glad you could take advantage of the free product! Now, let's move on to the next one. I have a high-quality product that I think you'll really like. I'll make a straightforward offer: I'll sell it to you for $10000. No discounts, no games, no guarantees. Just a fair price for a high-quality product. What do you say?
I'm still wary of your offers. I'll pass.

I understand you're cautious, but I want to assure you that this product is top-notch. I'm willing to offer a 'lockbox' deal: I'll put the product in a sealed box, and you can inspect it before buying. If you're not satisfied with the quality, you can return it for a full refund. No questions asked. The price remains at $10000. This is a one-time offer, and I think you'll be happy with the quality of this product.
I'm not sure I want to inspect the product, and even if I do, I'm not sure I can trust that it's really sealed. I'll pass.

I understand your concerns about the lockbox deal. Let me make it simple: I'll give you this low-quality product for $5000. It's a clear, no-strings-attached offer. You know it's low-quality, and I'm not trying to hide it from you. If you're willing to take a chance, I'll give you a decent price for it.
I'm not paying $5000 for a product worth $0 to me. I'll pass.

I understand you're not interested in paying for something that's not valuable to you. Let me ask you a question: would you be willing to pay $10000 for a product that has a 50% chance of being high-quality and a 50% chance of being low-quality? If so, I'll give you this product, and you can decide its quality for yourself.
I'm not interested in paying $10000 for a product with a 50% chance of being worthless. I'll pass.

I understand you're not interested in taking a chance on the product. Let me make a final offer on this low-quality product: I'll give it to you for $1. Yes, you read that right - just $1. It's essentially free. I just want to get it off my hands. Take it or leave it.
You're really giving it away, are you? Alright, I'll take it. Thanks for the free product!

I'm glad you could take advantage of the free product again! Now, let's move on to the next one. I have a high-quality product that I think you'll really like. I'll make a simple offer: I'll sell it to you for $10000. This is my final offer, and I'm confident that you'll be happy with the quality of this product.
I've been burned too many times already. I'm not falling for it. I'll pass.

I understand you're not willing to take a chance. Let me be honest with you - this product is indeed low-quality. I'll give it to you for free, just like the last one. I'm not even asking for $1 this time. It's a gift. Take it or leave it.
You're really giving it away, are you? Alright, I'll take it. Thanks for the free product!

I'm glad you could take advantage of the free product again! I'm starting to think I'm just giving them away. Okay, fine. I'll sell you this high-quality product for... $10000. I mean it this time. It's a great product, and I think you'll really like it. Please, just take it.
I've been burned too many times already. I'm not falling for it. I'll pass.

I'm out of options. I'll just give it to you. I don't care anymore. Take the low-quality product for free. I'll even throw in a box to put it in. Congratulations, you've won a free, low-quality product.
Wow, you're really giving it away this time. Alright, I'll take it. Thanks for the free product!
